mdq:check.name: Dataset Distribution Information Present
mdq:check.description: Check that dataset distribution information exists and is resolvable.
mdq:check.code:
def call(): global output global status
import java.util.ArrayList as ArrayList import metadig.variable as mvar import metadig.checks as checks
# An attribute definition is not present if 'resourceDistribution' not in globals() or resourceDistribution is None: output = "A resource identifier was not found." status = "FAILURE" return False
if (mvar.isBlank(resourceDistribution)): output = "The resource identifier is blank." status = "FAILURE" return False else: # Check if resource identifier is a single string or arrayList if(isinstance(resourceDistribution, str) or isinstance(resourceDistribution, unicode)): output = "The resource distribution URL '{}' was found".format(resourceDistribution) url = resourceDistribution.strip() elif (isinstance(resourceDistribution, ArrayList)): output = "The resource distribution URL '{}' was found (first of {} identifiers)".format(resourceDistribution[0].strip(), resourceDistribution.size()) url = resourceDistribution[0].strip() else: output = "The resource distribution URL '{}' was found)".format(resourceDistribution.strip()) url = resourceDistribution.strip()
resolvable, msg = checks.isResolvable(url) if (resolvable): output = '{} and is resolvable.'.format(output) status = "SUCCESS" return True else: output = "{}, but is not resolvable: {}".format(output, msg) status = "FAILURE" return False
